conclusion: If the light source moves forward above the objects, the shadows A, B, C, and D will change in both position and size.
As the light source moves forward, the shadows will shift backward relative to the objects.
This is because the light is now coming from a more forward position, causing the shadows to be cast further behind the objects.
The size of the shadows will also change.
When the light source is directly above the objects, the shadows are at their smallest.
As the light source moves forward, the shadows will become larger.
This is because the angle of the light increases, causing the shadows to stretch out more.
As the light source moves forward above the objects, the shadows A, B, C, and D will shift backward and become larger.
